item.title: “China keeps the algorithm”: Critics attack Trump’s TikTok deal
item.description: Trump’s TikTok deal requires US to make its own version of the app.

item.title: Trump Postpones TikTok Ban Enforcement for Fourth Time as He Claims ‘We Have a Deal’ With China to Sell App’s U.S. Operations to ‘Very Big Companies’

item.title: Will TikTok go dark Wednesday? Trump claims deal with China avoids shutdown.
item.description: Experts aren’t sure China will agree to a sale without more trade war concessions.

item.title: Trump, who promised to save TikTok, threatens to shut down TikTok
item.description: “TikTok is going to go dark,” commerce secretary warns as negotiations falter.

item.title: Chinese firms rush for Nvidia chips as US prepares to lift ban
item.description: H20 chips, designed to skirt export bans, are back after Trump meets with CEO.
